DataElement.preferredName: Platelet Count 100000 Recovery Occurrence Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to Indicate the number of days required for a platelet count to recover to at least 100,000 per cubic milliliter.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: platelet. An irregularly shaped disklike cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting. A platelet contains granules in the central part (granulomere) and, peripherally, clear protoplasm (hyalomere), but no definite nucleus; is about one-third to one-half the size of an erythrocyte; and contains no hemoglobin. (STED98)_To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A number with no fractional part.::100000_The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.__gradual healing (through rest) after sickness or injury._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.:A number with no fractional part.::100000:The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The determination of the number of platelets in a biospecimen.

Property.preferredDefinition: gradual healing (through rest) after sickness or injury.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Blood Cell Count Recovery Day Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood.  Also called complete blood count (CBC)._A getting back or regaining._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Blood Cell Count Recovery Day Count
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A test to check the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a sample of blood.  Also called complete blood count (CBC).:A getting back or regaining.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the number of red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets in a biospecimen.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.
